quotes.content: IBM was born German. Its technology was originally created for only one reason: to count people as they have never been counted before.
Experts predicted spending more than a decade to count the 1890 census
quotes.comment: This would have meant that the 1900 census would start before the 1890 census tabulating was complete, they certainly needed a solution.

quotes.content: Numbers and punch cards would probably kill them all
quotes.comment: This statement was in reference to the efficiency with which Jewish people and others deemed undesirable were tracked, relocated, worked to death, tortured and killed.

quotes.content: another who found Hitlerism compelling was Thomas J. Watson, president of...International Business Machines
quotes.comment: IBM's assistance of Nazi's was no accident. It was quite intentional.

timeline.event: Hollerith patents and builds a production machine for counting and analyzing the dead for local health departments.
US census Bureau sponsors a contest.
